7. The dwell loop extends around the drum, and the dwell stretch further includes at least two rollers disposed laterally adjacent to one another below the drum for guiding the web to and from the drum.
8. The suction device is advantageously disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt, causing the textile web to adhere to the belt and to be entrained thereby.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an air flow system for a dry cleaner.
• The system induces ambient air into the access opening of the machine whenever the door is opened.
• The system is exclusive of the air recirculating system and substantially reduces exhausting the residual solvent vapors from the tubs.
• The system includes a separate intake fan and duct, with a normally closed valve so that during normal operation of the machine the separate intake system is isolated from the solvent vapors developed during the cleaning cycle.
• The valve is opened in response to the access door being opened, and the intake fan is energized to draw air into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct.
• The vapors within the tubs are retained, and the loss of solvent is minimized.
• The system provides an air flow in through the access opening and directly into the interposed duct with only that vapor generally immediately adjacent the open end of the tubs commingling with the intake air.
• The system includes a timer-energized component during each portion of the dry cleaning cycle.
• The system includes a refrigeration system for solvent vapor recovery.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments.
• Conventional broad loom non-eductive production machines can be classified into two arts: eductive “open” spinning systems and non-eductive “closed” spinning systems.
• Eductive systems inherently create high levels of turbulence and vorticity that are hard to control.
• Non-eductive systems typically permit somewhat more web formation control than do eductive systems, but have fiber spin speed limitations.
• Hybrid systems were conceived primarily to increase the spin speeds of non-eductive systems.
• The system and method of the present invention involve an initial quench chamber and the use of a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width.
• By selecting a suitable slot gap opening, the necessary drawing tension can be obtained.
• The apparatus is constructed and the method carried out within certain ranges of parameters.
• The length of the quench chamber for a particular application will depend upon the material being spun and the particular web properties desired.
</summary>

• The present disclosure relates to a sewing machine, an embroidery unit, and a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a sewing machine control program that enable easily setting a position, on a work cloth, at which sewing is performed.

• Embodiments provide a sewing machine that includes at least one detecting portion, a processor, and a memory.

• The at least one detecting portion is configured to detect an ultrasonic wave that has been transmitted from a transmission source.

• The memory is configured to store computer-readable instructions that instruct the sewing machine to execute steps including identifying a position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave based on information pertaining to the ultrasonic wave that has been detected by the at least one detecting portion, and controlling sewing based on the position of the transmission source that has been identified.

• Embodiments also provide an embroidery unit that can be attached to and detached from a bed of a sewing machine, and to which an embroidery frame can be attached, and that is configured to move the embroidery frame, the embroidery frame being configured to hold a work cloth.

• The embroidery unit includes at least one detecting portion and a notifying portion. The at least one detecting portion is configured to detect an ultrasonic wave that has been transmitted from a transmission source. The notifying portion is configured to notify the sewing machine of a detection timing at which the ultrasonic wave was detected by the at least one detecting portion.

• The embroidery unit is configured to move the work cloth based on a position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave that has been identified by the sewing machine based on the detection timing that has been notified by the notifying portion.

• Further, a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a control program executable on a sewing machine is provided, which includes computer-readable instructions, when executed, to cause the sewing machine to perform the step of identifying, based on information pertaining to an ultrasonic wave that has been detected by at least one detecting portion of the sewing machine, a position of a transmission source of the ultrasonic wave.

• The at least one detecting portion is configured to

• The present invention relates to a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric or textile material, comprising a blend of wool particles or wool powder as a carrier for functional additives. (0044)
• The preparation is an aqueous suspension comprising a functional additive, ultrafine wool powder, and an aqueous binder. (0045)
• Examples of known functional additives for ultraviolet protection and/or anti-bacterial property include zinc oxide or ultrafine zinc oxide, titanium dioxide or ultrafine titanium dioxide. (0046)
• An exemplary preparation of a first embodiment of a preparation will be described below. (0048)
• The wool fibre is pulverized into ultrafine powder by means of rotary blade, and the functional additives are added to form the preparation. (0053)

• The present invention relates to a frame quilting machine for sewing patterns into large fabrics, such as bedspreads or quilts.
• The machine comprises a large frame, a sewing machine head, and a quilting table that can move in the X-direction, Y-direction, or any combination of both.
• The invention also includes a reprogrammable computer that can control the sewing machine function and the quilting table movement, allowing for easy pattern duplication and modification.
• The present invention simplifies the process of reprogramming the computers by segregating the functions of the sewing machine and the quilting table movement, allowing for separate reprogramming of each function.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of making nonwoven fabrics, particularly two-sided fabrics with a three-dimensional image. (0001)
* The invention involves hydroentanglement of precursor webs with a fiber distribution control layer to form a nonwoven fabric. (0002)
* The fabric exhibits a pronounced three-dimensional image that is durable to converting and end-use applications. (0003)
* The invention contemplates the use of staple length fibers or substantially continuous filaments for the fibrous matrix. (0004)
* Pre-entangling of the precursor webs can be done on a foraminous surface prior to hydroentanglement on the image transfer device. (0005)
* The invention can be used to make wipes, medical and hygiene products, and other applications where a two-sided fabric with a three-dimensional image is desired. (0006)
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
* The device includes a control means that is actuable by the strip of material to control the switching functions of the sewing machine.
* The control means includes a stop that is movable into the feed path of the strip and can be contacted by the strip to stop the feeding.
* The stop is displaced by a setting means in the form of an air cylinder and is substantially perpendicular to the feed motion of the workpiece.
* The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops.
* The device ensures a continuous operation, makes it possible to sew relatively stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances.
* The invention is directed to a device that includes a guide chute for a strip of material that overlies the bed plate over which a workpiece material is fed.
* The stop is arranged in the feed path of the strip for contacting and stopping the feeding of the strip, which is displable out of the path and connectable by control means to the sewing machine for controlling the operation of the sewing machine in accordance with the position of the stop and the strip material.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tank top, lower end portion of baseball stockings, a neck rope portion of an apron, or the like.
* The invention provides a connective knitting method of two tape-shaped knit pieces which is employed in a knitting procedure of a tape-shaped knit piece and a tape-shaped knit fabric knitted thereby.
* The method includes steps of knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces by a flat knitting machine possessing at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, either or both of which are composed to be movable in the longitudinal direction, the two tape-shaped knit pieces being positioned with a boundary between them in the longitudinal direction on either of the front and rear needle beds.
* The invention is devised to solve the problem of linking the end portions of the tape-shaped knit fabric in a knitting procedure, whereby the end portions of the tape-shaped knit fabric are joined by the knitting machine in a state where the end portions are overlaid and linked in a knitted state.
* The method includes forming a new loop on an overlaid loop by a proper number of times depending on the width of the knit fabric, and thereby joining the end portions of the tape-shaped knit fabric in a knitted state.
* The invention provides a connective knitting method of two tape-shaped knit pieces which is employed in a knitting procedure of a tape-shaped knit piece and a tape-shaped knit fabric knitted thereby, whereby the end portions of the tape-shaped knit fabric are joined by the knitting machine in a state where the end portions are overlaid and linked in a knitted state.
* The invention provides a knit fabric knitted by the above method, which has improved productivity and reduced manufacturing cost.
* The invention provides a knit fabric having improved appearance and comfort, whereby the end portions of the tape-shaped knit fabric are joined

<summary>
* The invention relates to a flexible traction element made of stranded cables, which can be wound and unwound, particularly for passenger and/or goods lifts. (0001)
* The invention also relates to a production line for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic material, which includes a reel for unwinding the strands, a device for orienting the strands, a heater for preheating the strands, and a cooling trough. (0002)
* The invention aims to provide a traction element with increased flexibility and improved adhesion between the strands and the plastic material jacket over the long term. (0006)
* The stranded cables are sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic material layer, and the temperature region applied during stranding can cause penetration of the plastic material into cable grooves. (0008)
* The individual fibers guaranteeing tensile strength of the stranded cables are steel, aramid, glass, ceramic, or carbon fibers, and the flexible thermoplastic material sheathing the core strands is polythene, polypropylene, polyurethane, or polystyrene. (0010)
</summary>

* The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, particularly to a new and useful rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine (1).
* The rotary hook arrangement includes a rotary hook (17) with a hook body (18) and a hook tip (19), a bobbin housing (20) supported in the hook body (18), and a capsule release device (50) that includes an eccentric (40) and a finger (46).
* The bobbin housing (20) has a bobbin (not shown) and a removable bobbin capsule (22), and the rotary hook (17) is arranged to rotate around the bobbin housing (20) in a horizontal plane.
* The capsule release device (50) is arranged to rotate the bobbin housing (20) counter to the direction of hook rotation (A) during the formation of a stitch, and the eccentric (40) moves the finger (46) against an abutment surface (48) to give the bobbin housing (20) a slight rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation (A).

<summary>
* The invention relates to materials and methods for producing silicon-based micro and nanofibers for various applications.
* The invention involves the use of liquid silanes, polymers, accelerants, and solvents to produce silicon nanowires and composites through electrospinning.
* The electrospinning method allows for the direct transformation of liquid silanes into a-Si nanowires without the need for a localized catalyst on a substrate.
* The invention offers a viable method for utilizing liquid cyclosilanes and linear or branched silanes in the fabrication of electronic materials, and manages stress in 1D wires by reducing dimensionality from 2D films to 1D wires.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel.
* The invention provides an arrangement for controlling tension of threads in a spool creel having a plurality of spool holders.
* The arrangement includes a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different corresponding spool holder.
* The controllers have a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension responsive, braking element coupled to the brake rotor.
* The arrangement also includes a tensioning lever coupled to the braking element for biasing it, and a biasing arrangement coupled to the tensioning lever.
* The biasing arrangement is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight, and the fluid pressure is controllable in common for all the biasing arrangements.
* The invention provides an improved tension control in a creel arrangement where each spool holder is provided with a fluid pressure sensitive biasing arrangement, which influences the tensioning lever, and the fluid pressure is controllable in common for all the biasing arrangements.

• The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
• The detector includes a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft, first, second, and third light shielding discs mounted coaxially on the shaft, and a module section connected to the shaft via an optical fiber cable.
• The first light shielding disc detects the sewing machine speed and a needle UP position, while the second light shielding disc detects a needle DOWN position. The third light shielding disc detects a thread trimmer timing position.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process for producing a viscose rayon yarn with a high degree of whiteness.
* The process involves partial coagulation and drawing of the yarn, completion of the coagulation, washing under specific conditions, drying, and possibly finishing.
* The invention offers several advantages over traditional processes, including reduced treatment liquors, simpler and more rapid processing, and improved degree of whiteness.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a small deaeration tank for use in an oxygen bleaching process.
* The tank is designed to deaerate pulp before it is washed, improving the efficiency of the process.
* The tank has an inlet pipe for receiving pulp, an outlet for removing deaerated pulp, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe for inducing a swirling motion in the pulp.
* The tank is typically cylindrical in shape and has a diameter equal to or slightly larger than the diameter of the oxygen reactor.
* The tank is closed and may be at atmospheric pressure or under low pressure, and it has a pressure recovery system for recovering oxygen or steam.
* The deaeration tank is designed to maintain a consistent pulp consistency, typically between 1-5%, and the amount of filtrate flowing through a line connecting the tank to a subsequent washer is controlled to maintain the desired consistency.
</summary>

<summary>
• This invention improves upon the existing art by providing biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite structures with improved properties including a very high structural performance (including out-plane stiffness) and strength-to-weight ratio.
• The invention uses a methodology called “function-oriented material design” (FOMD) to design materials for specific, demanding tasks, and results in a wide range of new BTR composites.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a load-limiting device for use in a braced frame during a dynamic event.
• The load-limiting device is designed to plastically deform in response to high lateral loads, absorbing energy and limiting the damage to the structure.
• The invention provides a method for using the load-limiting device, including integrating it into a structural frame and periodically checking its plastic deformation after dynamic activity.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet, and more specifically, to a unit type bedroom cabinet which is optimal for providing a flophouse facility with a number of individual rooms on the floor of an existing building.
* The bedroom cabinet is composed of a hexahedron formed by four side surfaces, an upper surface, and a lower surface, and includes an outer casing and an inner casing. The outer casing is formed by upper and lower outer casings, and the inner casing is positioned within the outer casing. The bedroom cabinet provides a clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing, which can house therein wirings or the like for interior electric devices.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a portable guard rail support and assembly for use in erecting a temporary safety barrier at construction sites.
• The invention aims to provide a simple and efficient guard rail system that meets safety guidelines and can be easily assembled and disassembled.
• The guard rail support consists of a flat bottom plate, an upright column, at least one guard rail support bracket, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring.
• The guard rail support is secured to the floor via suitable fasteners driven through bores formed in the base plate.
• Lengths of stock lumber are positioned and secured within the corresponding rail supporting brackets and retaining flanges of adjacent guard rail supports to form a guard rail assembly.
• The fall protection tie-off ring provides retaining and attachment means for a safety cable, which may be used to protect workmen from accidental falls.
• The guard rail assembly may be used to fasten weatherproof tarpaulins to protect workmen and the site from inclement weather conditions.
• The distance between guard rail supports is slightly less than the length of stock lumber to be used for the guard rails.
• The guard rail assembly consists of upper and lower wooden rails and a kick board, which span at least the distance between corresponding rail supporting brackets.
• The invention provides a portable and simple guard rail system that is effective in preventing accidental falls and meets safety guidelines.
• The invention can be used at construction sites, particularly in the erection of high-rise apartment and office buildings.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs to enhance production using a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods, and the processing of the recovered crude oil into its components.
* The invention provides a method and apparatus for recovery of crude oil from oil-bearing soils and rock formations using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic discharges in one or more wells that produce acoustic and coupled electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations that can cause oil flow to be enhanced and increase the estimated ultimate recovery from reservoirs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present disclosure relates to a system and method of splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length in an MSE structure.
* The splice may include a first wave plate defining one or more first transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element, and a second wave plate defining one or more second transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of a grid-strip.
* The splice may further include a first perforation defined in the first wave plate and a second perforation defined in the second wave plate, and a connective device extensible through the first perforation and the second perforation to couple the first wave plate to the second wave plate.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, which is produced with basic manufacturing processes allowing efficient production. (0009-0012)
* The invention provides a blade construction including a multiple component assembly, allowing the blade to be rebuilt by replacing a worn portion, and a process of ejecting a specific fluid at specific points along the blade to maximize the desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid. (0013-0022)

• The present invention relates to a building system, particularly a stucco type cavity wall construction technique and related assemblies, subassemblies, procedures, and methods. (0001)
• The invention aims to provide a building and/or a building system that can create panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height and/or greater than 4 meters width without movement control joints. (0005)
• The invention provides a building and/or a building system that can at least provide the public with a useful choice by complying with the plaster code NZS4251 and the building code NZS3604. (0010)
• The invention provides a stucco wall comprising or including a stud, battens, mesh or the like perforate reinforcement sheet(s), additional regional reinforcement mesh, lattice and/or perforate reinforcement, and a plaster or cementitious matrix. (0053)
• The invention has a wall that has a frame or substructure, battens, a first mesh, a second mesh, and a plaster matrix applied as more than one layer. (0072)
• The invention has at least one opening selected from a group consisting of door and window openings, and the or each opening is positioned only as allowed and is further reinforced in the plaster matrix. (0078)
• The studs are of minimum cross-section of 45 mm×90 mm, and there are dwangs at nominal 900 mm spacings between the studs. (0081)
• The batten attached mesh is of a metal, and the batten attached mesh overlies a backing sheet. (0082)
• The battens are of nominal 35 mm×40 mm cross-section, and the second mesh is non-metallic. (0084)

<summary>
* The background of the invention relates to the field of safes adapted to contain valuable papers and articles.
* The invention provides a new and improved safe and door structure, which includes a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and grooves formed on the opposite walls for receiving a separate steel door.
* The door is engaged with the grooves and laterally displaced until the edge of the door is in abutment with the seat of the shallower groove, and a lock assembly on the reverse side of the door has the latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement with reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt preventing transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a method for measuring fluid pressures in geological formations with greater accuracy.
• The invention isolates the pressure sensor in a borehole using a cement grout between the pressure sensor and the borehole, and then opening a communication path in the cement grout between the pressure sensor and the wall of the borehole where the formation fluid pressure is to be measured.
• The invention includes forming a borehole in the subterranean formation at least to a depth where the fluid pressure is to be measured, and then placing a conduit into the borehole to a depth so that a bottom inlet end of the conduit is laterally adjacent a location where the formation pressure is to be measured.
• The invention uses a non-return valve in the conduit so that liquid cannot pass upwardly all the way through the conduit.
• The invention places a cementitious material in the borehole until the cementitious material rises at least above the bottom inlet end of the conduit.
• The invention pumps a liquid down the conduit through the non-return valve, out of the inlet end of the conduit and into the cementitious material in the borehole to displace the cementitious material around the bottom inlet end of the conduit to thereby form a fluid connection to the formation.
• The invention measures the fluid pressure of the formation at the desired depth using a pressure sensing device coupled to the formation fluid pressure within the conduit.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, more specifically, a jointing structure which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter and the like, ensures high slip resistance to tires, permits less occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations and is easy to be given maintenance.
* The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.
* The present invention is useful in applications mainly to vehicle traveling path joints in new transit systems, monorails and the like, i.e., joints of vehicle traveling paths respectively built on bridge girders as an integral part thereof, and besides, to road bed plate joints in road bridges, foot bridges and the like.
* According to the present invention, it will be appreciated that even in the occurrence of any displacement such as the vertical differences in level and/or the lateral displacements and besides, the kinked joints in the joints of the bridge girders especially due to the earthquake or the like, the joint block may be conditioned to be always in the center of the expansion gap thanks to elastic member deformation for the elimination and/or relief of the differences in level and/or the lateral displacements and the like, resulting in the achievement of smooth vehicle traveling without the need for any emergency measures involving the use of the steel sheets or the like.
* It is noted that the use of a joint block made of the same concrete as that of the traveling path may be adapted to provide more substantially increased slip resistance to the tires, as compared with the rubber or steel expansion joint.
* The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice verse easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a floor transport system that prevents contamination of a sanitary fluid treatment chamber by wheeled hand trucks.
* The system includes an enclosed floor track system for transporting hand trucks into and out of the chamber without contaminating the fluid.

* The track system includes wheel channels with cover plates that can be pivoted away for cleaning.
* The wheel channels are structured to accommodate hand trucks with downwardly depending struts supporting the wheel structure.
* The cover plates are connected to the longer sidewall by a hinge, allowing them to be swung away for cleaning.
* The system prevents showered or dripping brine from entering the track system and instead drains it away separately from the solution on the chamber floor.
* The enclosed floor track system is well adapted for use with hand trucks having horizontally axled wheel structures.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, particularly a tractor loader backhoe.
* The lock device is constructed to lock a boom of an excavating device to a main body of the work machine.
* According to the invention, an engaging member is provided on one of the boom and a boom bracket, and an engaged member is provided on the other of the boom and the boom bracket.
* The lock device is designed to prevent the boom from falling by the weight thereof during traveling of the work machine, and to lock the boom to the main body when the boom is in its highest position.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to swimming pool vacuum cleaning devices.
• The device has a flexible platform with a central suction portion, adjustable relative to the pool bottom.
• The platform has a roller assembly connected to each end portion, with each assembly including at least two rollers.
• The rollers are adapted to maintain the end portions of the platform in a spaced relationship with respect to the pool bottom.
• The device also has a roller construction disposed on either side of the central opening, with each construction including a housing and spaced apart walls.
• The walls have end portions with vertical slots for receiving axles, which rotatably carry rollers for rotation about the axle.
• The device has a lead weight disposed intermediate the walls of the housing, a cover member superimposed over the lead weight, and a threaded connector for interconnecting the cover member with the platform.
• The adjustment mechanism of the invention is simple and easy to use, easy to connect to existing, prior art pool cleaning devices without major retrofit.
• The mechanism can be manufactured very inexpensively and is a novel feature of the present invention.
• The invention provides an adjustment mechanism of the character described in the preceding paragraphs in which the suction exerted by the vacuum head can be precisely regulated without the need for regulation of the remotely located suction source.
• The mechanism can be added to existing devices with minor changes, and is a kit form usable in combination with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to oil well drilling tools and apparatuses, specifically to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of the well head and casing.
* The apparatus of the present invention provides for a sub-body with a mandrel and a threadably removable lower collar section for threadably engaging the end of a second lower section of drill pipe.
* The retriever section of the apparatus is adapted with means, such as protruding members, radially around its exterior most vertical wall for engaging with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing following the lowering of the retrieving unit into the bushing.
* The present invention solves the problems in the present state of the art in a simple and inexpensive, straight-forward manner, providing a retrieving tool which is removably securable on the exterior surface of a sub-unit so that it may be mounted on a string of drill pipe independently of threading on the pipe.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage without the need for a plug.
• The dump valve is reconfigured into an annular shape to prevent slamming against a seat during cycling.
• The tool is designed with modular pistons that can be stacked to increase the delivered power from the vibrations.
• The mandrel is powered by stacked pistons in the tool body, allowing for a longer power stroke and more reliable operation.
• The tool can be operated in a manner where the high amplitude low frequency oscillating forces are delivered to the stuck fish without impacts of the pistons on the housing, improving reliability and reducing fatigue.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site.
• The invention provides an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall that saves on installation and transportation costs by using pre-manufactured assembly components, and allows for flexibility in height or width of any of the individual components.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well for improving production.
• The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional down hole heating systems: (1) the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and (2) existing systems fail due to design elements that are not protective enough for electrical components in the down hole environment.
• The present invention provides a down hole heating system that includes electrical resistance type heater rods, heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, stainless steel collars, and a heating unit with suitably shielded electrical connections. The system focuses and contains heat in the production zone to promote flow to, and not just within, the production tubing.

<summary>

* The invention relates to down hole tools for conducting mechanical activities in wells, specifically a mechanism for installation and retrieval of objects in wells.
* The mechanism includes an external pull tool or overshot that is adapted for use in well servicing operations or an internal pull tool or spear, depending on the service operation.

* The tool structure takes the form of an outer tubular body having an inner body structure disposed in movable relation thereto.
* The tubular outer body is secured about the inner body by means of a catch mechanism having a locking position and an unlocking position.
* A pin structure forms a part of the catch mechanism and selectively positions within pin receiving grooves.
* A control spring is employed to ensure that the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another.
* The invention provides down hole service equipment, such as wire line controlled pulling tools, that effectively becomes interconnected with down hole objects such as wire line tools, fish, etc.
* The tool may be locked in relation to the fish or other object positioned in the well bore by unlocking the catch mechanism and then re-locking it in the unlocked position.
* The invention is effectively adapted to be provided on a wire line controlled pulling tool and run into the well casing or well bore for the purpose of establishing a mechanical connection with an object positioned in the well bore and applying sufficient force thereto to remove the object from the well.

</summary>

• The present invention relates to a method for manufacturing a modular composed stave floor, which includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. (Para. 0018-0019)
• The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate in composed stave floors. (Para. 0019)
• The example embodiments provide floors with increased durability and allow for corrective maintenance without detachment or deformation. (Para. 0034)

<summary>
* The invention relates to ladders and their attachments, particularly for improving lateral stability and contact area.
* The present invention is directed to overcoming problems such as instability, defacing of the work surface, and inability to straddle corners.
* The brace assembly includes an arm with a flange and a resilient pad assembly, and the clamp is positioned between the siderail and the arm.
* The invention provides a non-slip gripping portion that grips the work surface without damaging it, and effectively increases the contact area of the ladder with the work surface.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to collated fasteners, specifically nail strips formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
• The invention provides a plastic collation system for strip-formed fasteners that reduces the tendency for the plastic to generate debris as the nail is driven into the workpiece, and minimizes the amount that the strip can flex, and maximizes the adhesion of the plastic to the nail shanks.

• The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, particularly silicones, in various industries. • The nozzle comprises a bell or hood lower section and an injection button, which provides several advantageous and novel characteristics for its intended function.

• The bell or hood section is designed to encapsulate rivets or nuts, and the injection button has a special design with multiple channels and orifices for precise sealant application.

• The button section allows for both manual and automated sealant injection machines, and its particular design improves encapsulation and provides an optimal seal.

• The nozzle has a coupling or matching between the bell-shaped tip and the injection button, which provides a strong and firm non-permanent connection.

• The invention represents a considerable improvement over existing products in its field, offering several advantages such as ease of use, precision, and versatility.

• The nozzle can be used in various industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics, among others.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to sensors, particularly position and motion sensors, and methods for reducing the number of wires required for multiplexing position sensors. (0001)
* Many mechanical systems contain moving parts that must be monitored for safe or efficient operation, and biodiesel fuels can make the fuel injection process more complex. (0003)
* Mechanical systems such as internal combustion engines contain multiple moving objects that must be monitored, and a method of reducing the number of wires is employed by connecting all sensors to the same set of wires and a single inline resistor. (0005)
* Position sensors generate an electrical signal that is proportional to the distance between the moving object and a fixed position, and unwanted electrical signals are divided into low frequency or high frequency noise. (0007)
* The present invention provides a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system. (0008)
* One embodiment of the invention includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator for modifying a sensing signal and providing a conditioned sensing signal. (0010)
* The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about a position of an object being sensed. (0011)
* One embodiment may include a window reference circuit that constantly compares a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the conditioned sensor signal output. (0012)
* The present invention may be embodied in many different forms and should not be construed as limited to the embodiments set forth herein. (0015)
* The invention will now be described more fully hereinafter with reference to the accompanying drawings, in which preferred embodiments of the invention are shown. (0016)
* With reference to  FIG. 1 , a position sensor is herein described as including a waveform generator for receiving an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and modifying the unconditioned sensing signal. (0017)
* Referring now to  FIG. 2 , compar

<summary>
* The invention relates to a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines.
* The system includes a cam and translating means that interact with a controllable actuating means to control valve position.
* The cam has a groove that displaces the translating means, which in turn displaces the valve.
* The system allows for infinitely variable valve displacement and is springless.
* The invention improves fuel economy and reduces gas consumption by controlling valve port openness.
* The system can be computer controlled for each valve and operate any set of pistons.
* The invention can be used in various engine configurations, including V-type and inline engines.
* The system provides smooth, sensitive control of engine performance and operation.
* The invention can be used in vehicles, such as cars and trucks, to improve fuel efficiency and reduce emissions.

• The present invention relates to aquarium lighting, specifically LED-based lighting.
• The invention includes a light member with a housing, a lighting control region, and one or more light-emitting modules.
• The lighting control region includes a first control channel, a second control channel, and a neutral channel.
• The light-emitting modules are electrically connected to the first and second control channels and a neutral channel.
• The modules are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and can be positioned along the lighting control region.
• The modules include a tab that releasably couples to a protrusion on the lighting control region.
• The modules include LEDs that emit white or blue light, and the color temperature is adjustable between 3500K to 15,000K.

* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid machine, particularly a gas turbine.
* The invention provides a simple and efficient solution to the problem of cooling hot gas flow in a fluid machine, particularly in a gas turbine.
* The invention involves using separate inserts instead of casting the separating walls in the blade, which simplifies assembly and attachment.
* The inserts are composed of metal or non-metal materials and can be easily replaced or adjusted to suit specific applications.

• The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, such as a throttle valve.
• The system comprises a control unit that receives a signal indicating accelerator pedal position and a signal indicating the position of the throttle valve, and provides an output signal to a DC motor for controlling the throttle valve position.
• The control unit switches from manual to automatic control when the throttle valve position matches the desired position commanded by the accelerator pedal signal, or when a malfunction is detected in the system.

<summary>
• The invention relates to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or directly from waste fuels such as wood waste.
• The inventor aims to provide a waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate matter within local environmental regulation limits.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a highly efficient evaporative cooling device that operates by conjunction of features, including a heat exchanger that separates its dry and wet sides, and evaporating water that is kept separate from the useful air to cool without adding water vapor.
* The device provides efficient cooling by drawing a major portion of the working air from the load, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than fresh air, and using it for cooling.
* The useful air is passed through a dry side heat exchanger, and a minor portion of it is passed over a vapor compression refrigeration system to provide additional cooling.
* The invention provides a hybrid evaporative cooler system that incorporates components of a vapor compression refrigeration unit, which can operate at a lower energy level and provide a lower temperature but with higher efficiency.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a fluid pump comprising two or more pump heads connected in series to pump fluid from a reservoir to a final outlet. (10014)
* The pump heads are connected by a drive structure that drives the impellers in each pump head, and the pump heads are connected by a combiner that combines fluid flow from at least two conduits into a single flow. (10011)

• The present invention relates to an engine including an engine compression release brake system for less than all engine cylinders. The system includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, and an engine compression release brake provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders. Each engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.
• The engine compression release brake system of the present invention provides improved overall robustness by reducing the number of components, such as by removing excess components, while still providing efficient engine braking. The system includes a modular design, where each cylinder has a movable piston, a fuel injector, a cam actuated exhaust valve, and a hydraulically actuated engine compression release brake. The engine compression release brake is operably connected to the exhaust valve for the cylinder and can be opened during the compression stroke of the piston.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure, such as an auxiliary gearbox.
• The mounting link includes a male link coupled to the engine or gearbox, a female link coupled to the engine or gearbox, and a pin releasably coupled to the male link and the female link to selectively retain the male link and the female link.
• The invention provides a technical function of allowing the female link to receive the male link to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and to form a radial interface, which dampens translation of the male link relative to the female link.
• The invention also provides a gearbox assembly including a gearbox and a mounting link to couple the engine to the gearbox, and a pin releasably coupled to the male link and the female link to selectively retain the male link and the female link.
• The invention can be used in aircraft gas turbine engines with a structural engine case, or another engine component to which the gearbox is secured.
• The mounting link can be utilized as a medium to long link to connect the engine to an associated structure, such as the gearbox, and can rigidly constrain one degree of freedom between the engine and the gearbox.
• The pin can selectively prevent the relative translation of the female link and the male link after the pin is broken or otherwise released.
• The pin can serve as a fusible link and shear when a sufficiently strong shock or heavy load is applied, and can be designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly, the unfused mount components, and the engine mounting structure.
• The invention provides a technical function of allowing the female link to receive the male link to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and to form a radial interface, which dampens translation of the male link relative to the female link.
</summary>

<summary>* The invention relates to archery equipment and provides a small, lightweight point cap system that can be adjusted for weight to obtain perfect balance. The point cap system includes a point cap and a balance pin, which can be varied in size to obtain the desired weight. * The invention also provides a means of attaching points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft, and a method of balancing an arrow using a balance pin and a point cap.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to military weapons and simulators, particularly the Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES).
• The invention provides a cost-effective means to simulate small arms fire noise and flash without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation.
• The SAFES utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system.
• The expendable contains a plurality of rounds and is installed in a firing unit which can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The invention provides a reliable, low-maintenance, reusable small arms training device that simulates realistic battlefield conditions without endangering personnel or damaging equipment.

• The present invention relates to an air intake device of an internal combustion engine that improves performance by utilizing the dynamic effects of the air flow. • The invention provides a tank defining a volume, a first pipe defining a first passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a second pipe defining a second passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, where the cross-sectional area of the second passage is smaller than that of the first passage.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a bracket for mounting speakers or other equipment on a pole or other surface.
• The bracket consists of two parts: a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket.
• The adjustable bracket is attached to the object to be mounted and then positioned on the stationary bracket.
• The bracket assembly includes pole clamp assembly for mounting on poles and other surfaces.
• The invention provides a simple and effective way to mount a product on a pole or other surface, and can be used for a variety of applications, including loudspeakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, video cameras, and more.
• The bracket assembly can be used by one person to install a fairly heavy item, and it is designed for economic and time efficiency.

• The disclosed concepts provide a burner and modular heat utilizing appliances therefor, with the burner having a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, and air flows both through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and also around the fuel holder to be directed to flame and fumes just above the fuel holder to support secondary combustion.
• The burner has legs holding the combustion chamber well above ground level, and a pivotally coupled ash pan.
• The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances to the burner, and the modular heat utilizing appliances include closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a combustion engine, specifically a rotary engine, and its ignition and cooling system.
* The invention aims to provide an efficient combustion system while improving cooling characteristics to reduce the possibility of structural failure of the engine's housing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to turbines and minimizing flow disturbance during operational testing.
* The invention uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance caused by closing and reopening turbine control valves.
* The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, and the flow change due to closure of one valve is known.
* The invention uses a test compensation circuit to adjust the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance during testing.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture.
* The valve has a valve body with a bore and inlet passages for receiving the fluids, and an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
* The valve includes a valve member for directing the fluids through the valve, and a flow restricting device to control the flow rate of the fluids.
* The valve body defines a third passage for receiving a retaining screw, and a threaded hole for receiving the screw.
* The valve member has a cylindrical portion with a bore, and a sealing sleeve for compressing the sleeve against the walls of the bore.
* The valve further includes a series of cylindrical spools for retaining a fluid seal ring, and a set screw for restraining translational motion of the valve.
* The valve is adjustable to permit the mixture to range from 0% first fluid to 100% second fluid, and from 0% first fluid to 100% second fluid.
* The invention provides a stand-alone cleaning apparatus for cleaning commercial aircraft without disrupting other members of the team.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
• The method includes compressing the gas delivered in the pipeline with an entry pressure in a compression procedure to a higher pressure, subsequently cooling the gas by a heat exchange, and feeding the gas for further transportation to the pipeline with a lower exit temperature.
• The invention also relates to an arrangement for carrying out the method, including compressors, heat exchangers, valves, and control units.
• The method starts from the fact that it is known to carry out the compression of a gas supplied at an entry pressure below the nominal pressure (rated pressure of the gas pipeline) to an increased pressure.
• The present invention utilizes the known physical effect according to which a compressed gas is cooled when expanded to a lower pressure, and provides that the gas to be transported is compressed to an excess pressure which is substantially above the exit pressure, and subsequently cooled by heat exchange before being expanded to the desired exit pressure.

• The present invention relates to a cooling fan mounting system that eliminates the need for fasteners traditionally used to secure cooling fans to an enclosure.
• The system includes a motor, fan blade, and a mounting assembly that attaches the fan to a panel or stationary member.
• The mounting assembly comprises resilient legs that are urged towards the exterior of the enclosure once the fan is installed, preventing the motor carrier from moving and ensuring proper alignment.
• The system offers several advantages over traditional fastening methods, including reduced cost, improved reliability, and increased cooling efficiency.
• The present invention is applicable in various applications, including computer tower, automotive, and electronic instrumentation, among others.

* The invention relates to clutch units of the oil shear type, particularly for large size power transmission applications.
* The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, a plurality of clutch plates connected to one of the shafts, and a plurality of clutch discs interleaved between the clutch plates.
* The clutch discs extend outwardly from the clutch plates and each disc comprises a plurality of arcuate segments in a circumferential arrangement.
* The invention provides an improved oil shear type clutch unit that utilizes hydraulic fluid for dual purposes: retracting the plate actuating means and as a coolant for the clutch discs.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a combustion engine with multiple expansion cylinders associated with a combustion cylinder to provide a surface area and volumetric displacement sufficient to lower the temperature of fluids associated with the engine, allowing for the elimination of a radiator.
* The invention also includes a catalytic material placed on surfaces that will "see" the hot exhaust gases, allowing for catalytic conversion of impurities in the gases within the engine itself.
</summary>

* The invention relates to the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat treated to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance. (1)
* The fabrication method described in patent EP 0971044 can be applied to butt-welded blanks, but it has a drawback: when welding coated steel blanks, a portion of the initial surface pre-coating is transferred into the molten area created by the welding operation. (2)
* The present invention provides a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of a layer of intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate, topped by a layer of metal alloy. (3)
* The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm, and the width of the area from which the metal alloy has been removed can vary. (4)

<summary>
• The present invention pertains to a remote control system and algorithm for supervisory control and data acquisition enabling navigation and automatic operation of a mobile energy recovery system.
• The invention relates to a top-level diagram of all components in an exemplary system, including a mobile structure in the process of energy extraction, a central service facility for service logging, maintenance, and bulk energy storage, and various sources of weather data.
• In the exemplary embodiment, the SCADA system tracks the position and velocity of the mobile structure through a GPS system and receives weather data from weather satellites and telecommunications satellites.
• The remote control system of the present invention applies to any mobile structure that extracts energy from electrical storms, windstorms, offshore tropical storms or hurricanes, or any aerodynamic or hydrokinetic electromechanical mobile system for renewable energy recovery.
• The algorithm in the present invention optimizes energy extraction using yield functions derived from weather and geospatial data and vessel performance models, and the same system using just the path cost algorithm without weighing energy extraction yield factors into the cost of travel may guide navigation of vessels for logistics-only purposes past such weather patterns.
• The present invention is not limited to implementation of the Turbine-Integrated Hydrofoil system of U.S. Pat. No. 7,298,056, but applies to remote control of any system that exploits energy from weather patterns that avail formidable amounts of naturally occurring energy.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a sheet metal material and composed of several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction. (1)
* The ring element is composed of at least three flat material ring segments S 1 , S 2 , S 3 which are joined together in succession in the circumferential direction. (2)
* The flat material ring segments S 1 , S 2 , S 3 are welded together via joints F 1 , F 2 , F 3 . (3)
* The ring element obtains an axial profiling in the context of a forming step, wherein the ring element forms several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction. (4)
* The flat material ring segments S 1 , S 2 , S 3 are cut out, in particular punched out, according to the invention from a sheet metal material. (5)
* The ring segments are put together in the region of the engagement zones and are welded along edge regions which face one another within joints. (6)
* The invention has the advantage of significantly reducing the cutting waste in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages produced by forming techniques, which can be achieved at relatively low cost from a process engineering perspective. (7)

* The present methods and systems relate to processing and transmitting information to facilitate providing service in a telecommunications network. * The methods and systems obtain information associated with a customer's service location, including latitude and longitude coordinates, and update one or more databases with the coordinates.

* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields. * The system has two sensors for measuring the amplitude of the interfering field, and a control unit for calculating control signals for six coils based on the sensor signals.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method for investigating a sample, derived from a biological source, using CARS microscopy.
• The method involves sensing a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering by excitation of at least one resonance site of the sample by means of laser irradiation.
• The invention aims to provide a method for CARS microscopy that can furnish at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
• The term “bioorthogonal reaction” refers to chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without appreciably interfering with natural processes.
• The method can be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures normally not detectable by means of CARS microscopy.
• The present invention makes it possible to use small molecules that can be introduced deep into a corresponding tissue, since no steric hindrance occurs and, for example, they diffuse through a tissue.
• The method can also be used in particular to image structures that are not or only poorly detectable by means of conventional staining techniques, for example using fluorescent dyes.
• The invention is especially suitable for tagging in biological samples, for example nerve tissue, in which the intelligence of a tag can be combined with the specificity of vibrational spectroscopy.
• The structural properties of the chemical structures containing the resonance sites can be derived from the signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
• The method can be used to investigate samples derived from biological sources, including samples removed directly from biological systems, for example animal tissue samples, plant structures, and prepared specimens derived therefrom.
</summary>

• The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources.
• The invention may also be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of those routines when they are updated or used with new imaging technology.
• The electronic computer may display a histogram showing cumulative missing volume elements as a function of distance ranges and cumulative extra volume elements as the function of distance ranges.
• The first and second electronic files may provide text strings identifying the structure and the stored program may select the metric method from a set of metric methods according to a table mapping the text strings identifying the structure of the first and second electronic files to one of the set of metric methods to be used as the metric method.
• The stored program may further execute to display a function of the metric method as a graph together with function parameters entered by the user and to change the graph as the function parameters are changed by the user.
• The metric method may be a combination of: a constant value, a linear function of a number of error volume elements with distance, and an exponential function of the number of error volume elements with distance; wherein the error volume elements are missing volume elements and/or extra volume elements.
• The electronic computer may include a user input device for accepting a representation of the metric method to allow a user to set the metric method.
• The metric method may be a function of distance ranges and the distance ranges may be entered by the user.
• The stored program may display a cross-sectional image through the first and second volume models along a user-defined cross-sectional plane separately identifying the common volume elements, missing volume elements, and extra volume elements by different colors.
• The metric method may provide a summation of a first function based on the missing volume elements and a second function based on the extra volume elements so that the metric method increases monotonically with increased missing volume elements and extra volume elements.
• The stored program may further receive a third electronic file providing a cross-sectional image of patient tissue at the user-defined cross-sectional plane, and the cross-sectional images through the first and second volume models may be displayed superimposed on the cross-sectional image of patient tissue obtained from a third electronic file.

• The present invention relates to a method of tracking a specimen acquired from a patient, which involves storing in a computer storage a first machine-readable code present on an identification (ID) means worn by a patient, a second machine-readable code associated with an order to obtain a specimen from the patient, and a third machine-readable code present on an identification (ID) means worn by a specimen-taker.
• The method also involves selecting from a plurality of specimen containers having machine-readable codes that are unique to each other preapplied thereto one specimen container including a fourth machine-readable code preapplied thereto, wherein the fourth machine-readable code comprises a barcode that encodes a unique serial number and an expiration date of the container.

• The present invention relates to a voice activated distance measuring device for golfers, which uses GPS technology and voice recognition software to provide distance and other information to the user via a loudspeaker or headphone. (0009)
• The device may also accept verbal or any other data input and memorize and compute this, when prompted by voice command or an electrical pulse generated by touch or remote control, to predict golf course user golf strategy, club selection, rules and other golf player needs. (0018)

* The present invention addresses the problem of accurately reporting design rule violations in integrated circuits (ICs) that include both logic and memory regions.
* The invention provides a system and method for checking design rules that apply different rules to different regions of an IC based on the type of circuitry present in each region.
* The method modifies standard logic rules to accommodate more liberal parameters for memory regions, and only pushes these modifications onto the modified rules when necessary.
* The present invention is particularly useful in the semiconductor industry, where different design rules must be applied to different types of regions on a substrate, and where customized design rules can be created to harmonize multiple types of design rules from different vendors.

<summary>
• The invention relates to the use of waveguide holograms for illumination of objects with specific requirements.
• The illumination system comprises a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a light source, and a hologram recorded on the surface of the waveguide.
• The hologram grating is used to record the illuminator of the claimed invention.
• The inventors discovered that thin substrate waveguides can be used to provide improved, controlled illumination of objects, including holograms and spatial light modulators.
• The illumination system occupies much less space than a conventional lens illumination system.
• The diffraction efficiency of a WGH is defined as the fraction of light from the illuminating source that is diffracted into the required beam.
• Non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction is inevitable unless combated.
• The global efficiency of a WGH is expressed as the ratio of the total light entering the hologram to the total light emerging from the hologram.
• The local efficiency of a WGH is defined as the ratio of the light diffracted out of the hologram at a particular point to the total light entering the hologram at that point.
• The inventors have found that two-sidedness of a WGH can be solved by absorbing the light emerging from one side or by placing a mirror on one side to reflect all of the light into the same direction.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing rotors of dynamoelectric machines, such as electric motors and generators.
• The method and apparatus are designed to obtain the resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of the rotor.
• The test apparatus includes a test head for accepting and causing relative angular movement between the rotor and test head, and exciting means for magnetizing the rotor during such angular movement in response to an alternating current.
• The apparatus also includes voltage sensing means for generating a voltage signal responsive to the magnetic flux variations generated by the rotor in response to the magnetization by the exciting means, and current sensing means for sensing the magnitude of the alternating current utilized to magnetize the rotor and generating a current signal representative thereof.
• The processing means is used for determining the resistance and reactance of the rotor responsive to the voltage signal and current signal.
• In addition, skew sensing means may be provided for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor and generating an effective skew signal responsive thereto.
• The processing means is usable for determining an effective electrical skew of the rotor responsive to the effective skew signal.
• The invention provides a novel and improved method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors.
• The apparatus provides automatic pass/fail determinations, detailed statistical comparison and evaluation of the measurement results, and automatic identification of defective rotors.

* The present disclosure provides a method for securing a computing device by granting access to native resources of an operating system based on validated digital certificates associated with managed libraries. (0003)
* The method can include authorizing a managed application to access a specific native resource of the operating system through a managed library, where the managed library is validated using a digital certificate. (0004)

<summary>
    1. The invention relates to a low-cost, easily constructed identification card with an antenna and chip incorporated into the body of the card.
    2. The card contains two relatively shock-absorbing layers, which may contain indicia, and are sandwiched between two rigid outer laminate layers.
    3. The rigid outer layers disperse external forces over a broad area of compliant layers, protecting the electronic components.
    4. The identification card is made of a silica-filled polyolefin, which is opaque and has good color rendition.
    5. The first indicium is printed on one side of the core layer using a modified laser printer.
    6. Antennae and IC chips are printed onto the indicium in a matching pattern.
    7. The core layer with attached antennae and IC chips is bonded to a bottom sheet of printable polyolefin using an adhesive layer.
    8. Two layers of substantially transparent polymer are affixed to the bonded core layer/bottom layer structure.
    9. The image-receiving layer of the present identification document may be formed of any material capable of receiving an image by dye diffusion thermal transfer.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method for implementing a memory structure, specifically a functional memory, using a tree-shaped data structure.
* The invention aims to reduce the amount of required copying in the functional memory during updates, making the updates faster and requiring less memory space.
* The solution in accordance with the invention involves implementing and maintaining a queue by means of a tree-shaped structure in which the nodes have a given maximum size, and adding and deleting elements in a way that the leaf nodes remain at the same hierarchy level of the tree.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to embedded EPROM devices built using existing IC manufacturing technologies, providing a practical solution to the challenge of manufacturing EPROM devices on the same wafer as DRAM products without incurring additional costs.
• The invention provides EPROM devices for DRAM redundancy circuits using existing DRAM technology, as well as EPROM devices manufactured by standard logic technologies that do not require high voltages for operation.
• The novel device structures of the invention utilize existing circuit elements to build EPROM devices without complicating existing manufacturing processes, such as using DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors or utilizing transistor properties changed under stress conditions to support EPROM operations.

* The invention relates to a technique for determining the proper value of feedback gain in a feedback control system.
* The method of determining feedback gain according to the invention includes provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control using the provisionally determined gain, detecting an error between the actual and designated values, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and repeatedly executing the steps until a new feedback gain is determined.
* The invention provides a method of determining feedback gain that can quickly and accurately determine a feedback gain that provides a suitable evaluation value.
* The method uses the length of a curve obtained by plotting the error against the time axis as the evaluation value for the proportional gain, the integral of the error for the integral gain, and the integral of the absolute value of the error for the differential gain.

<summary>
    1. The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range.
    2. The invention aims to provide a zoom lens with a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end while reducing the total length of the lens system.
    3. The invention comprises a first lens unit of positive power for focusing, a second lens unit of negative power, a third lens unit of negative power for compensating for image plane shift, a fourth lens unit of positive refractive power, and a fixed fifth lens unit with image forming function.
    4. The invention satisfies certain conditions for the construction and arrangement of the elements of the fourth and fifth lens units to achieve good correction of aberrations and high-grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.
    5. The conditions include a range of refracting power for the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit, a range of refractive power ratio for the second lens unit to the whole of the fifth lens unit, a range of refractive power ratio for the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth lens unit, and a range of Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit.
    6. The invention also satisfies a condition for the physical length of the entire lens system to be reduced while still permitting high-grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.
    7. The fourth and fifth lens units are constructed in a specific form to correct residual aberrations in good balance.
    8. The invention provides four specific examples of zoom lenses with different radii of curvature, axial thicknesses, refractive indices, and Abbe numbers.
    9. The values of the factors in the invention's conditions for the numerical examples are given in a table.
    10. The invention achieves a reduction of the physical length of the entire lens system while minimizing the variation with zooming of the aberrations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons or the like in a detector.
* The method involves generating a charge pulse in the detector when a particle passes through and converting it into an electric signal.
* The device includes a detector for generating a charge pulse, a fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a slow amplifier for integrating signals upon exceeding a threshold value of the rate of the signals.
* The invention aims to provide a method and device that can detect both individual particles and integrate count rates without knowing the expected count rates.
* The low-voltage-side discharge of the charge pulse or signal provides a simpler distinction of small-size signals.
* According to a preferred embodiment, individual signals are amplified in the first fast amplifier, and signals are integrated in the second slow amplifier upon exceeding a threshold value of the rate of the signals.
* The invention also proposes the use of a material enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, such as diamond, for detecting uncharged particles.
* The method and device of the invention can be used in particle accelerators, reactor installations, and diagnostic devices such as X-ray devices or CT devices.
</summary>

• This invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly.
• The apparatus includes an enclosure having a stationary ring mounted thereon and a movable ring slidably supported thereon.
• A torque motor is provided with an output shaft connected to a splined hub, upon which the driven disc assembly is mounted for rotation between the two rings.
• Means are provided for selectively moving the movable ring toward the stationary ring so as to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly therebetween.
• When so engaged, the distance separating the two rings is measured by an electronic sensor.
• The torque motor is then energized to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly, attempting to rotate it against the frictional force generated by the rings.
• Means are provided for sensing this rotation and for measuring the distance separating the two rings at that time.
• The difference between these two distances is compared with a standard value to determine if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped.
• The apparatus operates automatically without manual involvement by an operator and generates an external indication to the operator of the test results.

<summary>
* The present disclosure relates to a method of generating a face age-estimation for a face represented by first image data as a function of faces represented by second image data and having assigned landmark points and known ages.
* In one implementation, the present disclosure is directed to a method of face age-estimation.
* The method includes extracting facial features from an image of a test subject and mapping the facial features to one of at least two differing age groups having corresponding differently calibrated mapping functions.
