* The present inventors have discovered that verification rates for image-based face age-estimation can be greatly improved by performing a contourlet transform on the first image data and by classifying the subject face according to aging mechanisms.
* In one embodiment, a subject face is classified as younger or older before performing face age-estimation.
* Younger and older people have fundamentally different aging mechanisms, such that at least two aging functions can be constructed.
* Referring now to the drawings, FIG. 1A illustrates components of a face age-estimation training method according to an embodiment of the invention, while FIG. 1B illustrates components of a face age-estimation method according to an exemplary embodiment of the present invention.
* For illustrative purposes, FIG. 4 represents an exemplary computing system that can be used to implement various steps of methods and any other method incorporating features/functionality disclosed herein.
* Typically, the first image data received represents an image of one or more persons' faces for which ages are desired to be estimated.
* In one embodiment, image data may represent a single 2D image of front view of a subject's face, while, in other embodiments, further processing may be necessary to address issues such as side views of faces, tilted faces, etc.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, aiming to preserve the definition of the image with higher definition.
* One advantage of the invention is that it facilitates the implementation of algorithms, which can be carried out by the controller of the matrix display.
* The matrix display device includes at least one controller suitable for producing display light intensity signals for each of the pixels, and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of a plurality of identical arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels.
* Each of the arrangements can be formed by a square of four pixels, with three pixels of each arrangement associated with the light intensity signals intended for the corresponding pixels of the first image, and the remaining pixel associated with the light intensity signal intended for the corresponding pixel of the second image.
* The invention can be applied to matrices of different forms, and the display device may be a display of OLED, LED, or LCD type, or of any other known type, associated with a controller which is not represented in FIG. 1.

* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for a keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle, particularly an access and/or ignition control system. (0001)
* The problem addressed by the present invention is creating a mobile identification transmitter for a keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle which possesses an enlarged functionality and has a simple design, wherein the user is provided with a comfortable mobile identification transmitter. (0004)
* The invention provides a payment element removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, wherein the closure is separately arranged on the housing, and the identification transmitter can be set in a normal state and in a secure state. (0007)
* The invention also includes a configuration wherein via a corresponding, intentional activation of the identification transmitter, the payment element and/or the carrier can be removed from the receptacle of the housing by the user. (0014)

* The present disclosure relates to a method and apparatus for charging a developer in an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine. (0009)
* The method and apparatus are designed to address problems with the tribo charge of toner in the imaging device, which can affect the image quality after a delayed period of inactivity. (0010)
* The exemplary embodiments include determining periods of inactivity of the imaging device and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity. (0011)
* The method and apparatus can be included in a xerographic machine, and the tribo charge of the toner is returned to the level of normal operation after recovering from the inactivity. (0015)

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can independently and precisely regulate the bias currents supplied to multiple magneto resistive heads mounted on a rotary drum.
• The invention provides a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can switch over plural heads with high precision, particularly a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can switch over multiple MR heads and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum at high speed.
• Preferred embodiments of the invention will be described in detail below, including a block diagram illustrating a rotary magnetic head type apparatus, a rotary transformer for transmitting data between the stationary side and the rotary side, and a decoder for discriminating data of the control signals and controlling the bias currents for the MR heads.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a system and method for locating concealed objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The system comprises a transmitter and receiver, where the transmitter induces alternating currents in the objects, and the receiver senses magnetic fields associated with the currents.
• The invention improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object in the presence of an adjacent object, such as a buried pipe or cable.
• The transmitter has a pair of antennae for inducing distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and the receiver senses a pair of magnetic fields associated with the currents.
• The output signal characteristic is distorted when a second cable or pipe is present adjacent to the first, making it difficult to trace the desired cable.
• The invention employs a transmitter with a pair of antennae driven by RF signals, which generate corresponding magnetic fields that induce distinguishable currents in the cables.
• The receiver is moved back and forth over the ground to trace the desired cable, and the output signal characteristic is produced depending on the presence of both currents.
• The invention produces two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, making it possible to locate and trace one of the cables more easily and accurately than with prior art systems and methods.
• The system may be employed to trace a cable in the presence of an adjacent cable by adjusting the position of the transmitter to optimize further tracing operations.

• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a two-way speaker device with a telephone network.
• The apparatus includes a source of power for the interfacing apparatus, such as a transformer connected to a wall outlet.
• Selective switch means are provided for selectively connecting the interfacing apparatus with the telephone network to permit telephone operation in either a conventional manner or in an automatic answering mode.
• The interfacer device includes an optocoupler for coupling the telephone ringing circuit in a manner which discharges a charging capacitor to a predetermined signal level, and means are responsive to the discharge of the capacitor to connect the speaker phone to the telephone lines automatically in a hands-free manner in response to the telephone ringing signal.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers.
• The system utilizes the branch fiber optic cable, which transmits and receives optical signals, to deliver light energy to a remote location for signal amplification.
• The invention provides a cost-effective solution for undersea communications networks by reducing the number of undersea optical repeaters required.
• The system can be applied to both undersea and terrestrial communications networks, and can accommodate reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units.
• The invention respects sovereignty concerns in undersea communications networks by providing a trunk and branch structure that maintains full connectivity along the network and to all cable stations.
• The system can be used in a variety of wavelength-division-multiplexing (WDM) configurations, including time-division-multiplexing and other multiplexing techniques.
• The present invention is a significant improvement over traditional undersea optical repeater systems, offering reduced costs and improved network performance.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices, which provides a flat and even surface without visible fasteners.
* The device consists of a two-part construction, with an attachment member and a cover plate member, which are easily installed using available fasteners.
* The attachment member is symmetrical and has latching pawls placed on either side of a central tab, while the cover plate member has no fastener holes and a ridge with saw-toothed racks to accommodate the latching pawls.
* The cover plate member is proportioned to fit over the attachment member and the ganged box, and the latching pawls engage the saw-toothed racks to properly position the cover plate.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen.
* The device consists of annular strips concentrically nested and essentially enclosing one another in a tight manner.
* The strips are suitable to be fixed in front of a displaying screen and in that case surround the screen.
* The strips can be folded-in and folded-out of the light-shielding device.
* The device consists of as few parts as possible, is inexpensive to produce, operates reliably, and can easily be fitted to a monitor.
* The strips have a decreasing wall thickness, viewed in the axial direction, which allows the device to be set to various angular positions relative to the screen.
* The invention provides an adapter member providing a flat attachment face for the light-shielding device.
* The collapsible light-shielding device according to the present invention is suitable for use with various types of monitors, including those with a flat or single- or double-curved front.

<summary>
* The present invention discloses a solution that automatically informs a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when that rate likely exceeds a rate that a listener can understand.
* The invention can be implemented in accordance with numerous aspects, including an automated method to facilitate understanding between discourse participants, a device for facilitating understanding between discourse participants, and a method for facilitating comprehension during a discourse.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam, in order to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane on which the processes are optically projected.
• The device includes a cyclic line counter, which carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses respectively, N/p being an integer >>1, the end-of-count pulse being applied to the beam suppression circuit of the TV camera for picture beam suppression.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to multimedia communications and provides a solution for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions in a packet-based network.
• The invention provides a way to integrate multimedia capabilities with circuit-switched calls, and an exemplary embodiment uses a blended call approach.
• A blended call is a call that blends voice and multimedia functions into a single communication session, and the invention takes an incoming call from a remote caller and directs it to a multimedia server.
• The multimedia server has software that manages blended calls, and the software initiates parallel voice and multimedia components with the customer premises equipment.
• The voice session may pass through the telephony server with an indication that blended processing has occurred, and the blender further controls the signaling paths of the parallel components to accommodate multimedia requests at any stage during the call.
• The invention is designed to prolong the viability of existing network devices by allowing existing customer premises equipment and network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities.
• The present invention may be used on any number of network systems using a number of different protocols, and the communication environment depicted includes a packet-switched network with SIP-enabled devices.
• The invention connects clients to the communication network by one or more connections, and the connection may be wireless or wire-based.
• The telephony servers communicate with each other and other components in the communication network via a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T), and the database servers track which clients support which services.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to electronic service delivery and synchronization frameworks using dynamic attributes and file bundles for connected devices (<0007>)
* Existing synchronization methods do not determine how and in what order data synchronization is carried out, and do not provide data synchronization based on arbitrary sets of attributes (<0003>)
* The present invention provides a content synchronization method for connected devices, including accepting context from a client device, constructing responses in a semantic compatible with the device, prioritizing download order of files, and confirming complete download (<0007>)
* The present framework is highly scalable due to client device processing, and supports multiple languages and character sets from a central reference point and distributed content servers (<0015>)
* The present systems and methods employ file compression and concurrent priority based downloading to optimize synchronization algorithm and communication bandwidth usage (<0016>)
* The central reference point and client device share contextual information or dynamic attributes, and the central reference point composes a response based on the dynamic attributes and additional arbitrary attributes collected from an external partner system (<0020>)
* To support limited bandwidth and connection time, the present systems and methods employ data compression for responses and compose a delta list of files not locally available to the client device or for which a bundle provides a newer version (<0021>)
* In the event of communication connection failure, incomplete bundles are rejected, and synchronization ends when all bundles have been successfully downloaded (<0022>)
* Received bundles may be acted on via install URLs or file actions associated with bundle files, and bundle files are synchronized over any local copy of the bundles on the client device (<0023>)
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides systems and methods for facilitating communication between a finder of an object and an owner of the object. (0025)
* The invention allows a person, such as a finder of a lost or misplaced object, to anonymously communicate with another, such as the owner of the object. (0026)
* The systems and methods can be useful in facilitating the return of the object to its owner. (0027)
* In an aspect of the invention, an “owner,” which can be an individual or entity wishing to protect portable personal property, is provided with specially prepared tags. (0028)
* The tags have a unique identifying feature such as an ID and a reference to a specific website or other unique virtual locale. (0029)
* The owner would then affix tags to any portable possession which she desires to be easily returned to her if lost or otherwise separated from her. (0030)
* With reference to  FIGS. 2A and 2B , such tags can be of any size or shape or type, such as a printed adhesive label or a plastic key-ring tag with a hole for a key ring or keychain. (0031)
* In an embodiment, the owner would then register the tag IDs and the owner's contact information on a centralized and network accessible database according to the present invention. (0032)
* With reference to  FIG. 1A , a user, in this case, an owner, accesses a browser or client capable device, starting its operating system, and then navigates to the server and receives a main menu. (0033)

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electron multiplier with a series of thin foils used in an evacuated enclosure. (1)
* The foils are used to create secondary electrons, which are then accelerated through the series of stages. (2)
* The gain of the multiplier is modeled as a series of discrete dynodes, and the ability to cover a larger area is a major advantage of the invention. (3)
* The foil electron multiplier exhibits an intrinsic rejection of ion feedback at each stage, and the anode is contained within a supporting structure. (4)
* The invention may be used in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors, such as channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates. (5)
* The foil thickness enables the incident particles to travel through the foil and continue on to the anode or to a next foil in series. (6)
* The voltage on each stage can be applied by attaching electrical resistors between adjacent stages or by attaching separate power supplies. (7)
* The mean gain of the foil electron multiplier with N stages resulting from impact of a particle with the first stage is G N =γ I γ SE N−1. (8)
* The secondary electrons are transmitted through each foil with a probability T SE that depends on the foil thickness and accelerating potential. (9)
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system that allows almost any motion picture to be viewed effortlessly by the viewer with the visual effect of 3-dimensions.
* The invention uses a computer algorithm running on a computer processor to calculate in real-time, and from a multiplicity of media frames, the synchronization and control events.
* The 3-dimensional visual effect is produced by the 3-D Phenomenoscope regardless of whether the motion picture was shot on regular or digital film; regardless of whether the presentation media is film, digital film, VCR tape, or DVD; and regardless of whether the motion picture is viewed in the movie theater, home TV, Cable TV, or on a PC monitor.
* The Pulfrich effect is used in the invention of a 3-D Phenomenoscope, which recognizes that images that travel through a dark lens take longer to register with the brain than it does for an image that passes through a clear lens.
* The delay is not great—about 100 milliseconds—but it is enough to create the illusion of depth.
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope has no moving parts and no wire connections, and uses material that partially occludes or entirely clears in response to the received electronic signals.
* The invention allows any motion picture with a degree of sustained lateral motion (for instance, every ‘chase’ sequence) to be viewed with the visual effect of 3-dimensions.
* The human eye can sense and interpret electromagnetic radiation in the wavelengths of about 400 to 700 nanometers—visual light to the human eye.
* To facilitate vision, the human eye does considerable ‘image processing’ before the brain gets the image, including persistence of vision, stereopsis, perspective, motion parallax, and shadows.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer without using a wafer saw.
• The method includes forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and then applying a mechanical pressure to the semiconductor wafer to cause a "clean break" of the wafer along the trenches, thereby singulating individual die on the wafer.
• The invention is useful for reducing the time and cost associated with wafer singulation, as well as improving the yield and quality of the singulated die.
• The trenches are etched in the openings formed in the photo resist layer, which is patterned over the active surface of the wafer to define the scribe lines.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a field emission display panel or device, and more particularly to a protection structure for preventing burn-out damage to field emission elements in the device.
* The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that deflects ionic emission gas away from the field emission components of the device to prevent damage to the field emission components.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an image sensor that includes multiple imaging planes.
* The image sensor includes a semiconductor substrate with opposed major surfaces and opposed edges between the surfaces.
* The substrate has a first imaging plane on one edge, a second imaging plane on a top surface, and a third imaging plane on another edge.
* The image sensor elements are formed in the substrate and are arranged in columns along the length of the sensor.
* The image sensor includes a means for guiding charge carriers in the image sensing region toward the charge collection and transfer means.
* The present invention can be used to image in a plurality of planes, allowing the sensor to be used in many image formats.
* The image sensor can be formed using processing techniques that are compatible with other types of image sensors.
* The invention has been described in detail with particular reference to the preferred embodiments, but variations and modifications can be effected within the spirit and scope of the invention.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to networks, particularly home networks employing devices with power management systems.
• The invention addresses the need to minimize total power consumption while ensuring the best qualified device is promoted to network master role.
• Several embodiments provide methods for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
• The master device enters power management state after sending data to the slave device, which becomes the new network master node.
• The network master node receives instructions to enter power management mode and sends data enabling network administrative functions to a network slave node.
• The network slave node that received the network administrative functions becomes the new network master node after the master node enters power management state.
• The master node determines if there is any traffic on the network medium before entering power save mode.
• The master node sends a transfer request to network slave nodes before entering power save mode.
• The master node determines whether any network slave nodes have responded to the transfer request.
• The invention provides a method of managing power consumption in a network, including receiving an instruction for a first device in an active power state and serving as a network master node to enter into a power management state.

<summary>
• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation.
• The prior art of UK 1449196 is illustrated in FIG. 1, which shows a single equi-spaced triplet for which the two R.F. outputs A+C and B are shown.
• Measurement of elevation angle can only be made when S is non-zero, and is best made when S is changing slowly, with angle near its maximum value.
• The array may operate in either a transmit or receive mode, and unambiguous angle measurement is provided by the signal processing circuits embodied in the antenna receivers.
• The invention extends the ideas of UK 1449196 to optimize angle measurements using the triplet itself, notably over selected sectors at low elevation angles.
• The invention is applicable to civil and military applications where the measurement of the elevation angle of an emitting or reflecting object is required.
• FIG. 2 illustrates the principle of operation of an antenna array arranged as triplets.
• In FIG. 3, seven antenna elements are deployed as three triplets arranged to operate on responses from secondary surveillance radar interrogations.
• The invention aims to provide unambiguous angle measurements up to about 7 degrees and measurement accuracy and resolution of the order +/-0.05 degrees from 3 degrees.
• The design criteria are to provide the smallest number of antenna elements possible, with the lowest element not so close to the ground that it might be obscured, and the highest antenna element at an acceptable height.
• Typical values that might be chosen for d and h are then as follows: d = 1.5, h = 2.5(d) = 3.75, h = 7.75d = 7.5, h = 15.25.
• The highest element is at 22.75 wavelengths, which is about 7 meters from the ground.
• FIG. 4 shows the preferred measurement ranges for each triplet l, m, and n.
• The invention is applicable to monitoring the height of aircraft approaching to land, which is an important application.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a subminiature lamp assembly that solves the problems of conventional subminiature lamps.
• The invention utilizes a high temperature polymer that directly surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope.
• The polymeric material is somewhat rigid/molded and can be manually handled and used to manipulate the subminiature lamp.
• The elastomer used for the seal supported lamp assembly provides extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.
• The invention provides a solution that will provide a much longer bulb life by combating the above mechanisms of bulb degradation.
• The invention also helps provide further protection from burns for users, regardless of the type of appliance in which the bulb is used.
• The material used for the polymeric seal support is non-thermally conducting and able to withstand significant subminiature lamp temperature.
• The shape of the polymeric seal support can be a solid cylindrical rope that can be bored out to accommodate the glass envelope and fit any type of abbreviated height one piece conductive base.
• The part may also be a molded component, and any shape of fit between the abbreviated height one piece conductive base and the polymeric seal support which promotes structural cooperation, support, and effective bonding is encouraged.
</summary>

• The system model and notations used in the present invention are described, including the base station with N antennas and K user terminals with L k antennas each, the channel gain matrix H, and the input symbol vector u.

• The GDFE Precoder includes a feedforward path and a feedback path, and the interference pre-cancellation matrix G is used at the feedback path to process the input symbol vector u for interference pre-cancellation purposes.

• The interference pre-cancellation matrix G is represented as an Upper Right Triangular matrix with block diagonal sub-matrices being identity matrices each of size a k .

• The input covariance matrix for the downlink channel S xx is represented using its Eigen Value Decomposition (EVD) as S xx =VΣV H .

• The transmit filter B is used to process the symbol vector x obtained after the DFE stage of the GDFE Precoder.

• The main purpose of the interference pre-cancellation matrix G is to process input symbol vector u for interference pre-cancellation purposes, and its structure is that of an Upper Right Triangular matrix with block diagonal sub-matrices being identity matrices each of size a k .

• The input covariance matrix for the downlink channel S xx represents dependencies of symbols transmitted from different ones of the N transmit antennas, and a sum of diagonal matrix elements represents an intended total transmit power from the N transmit antennas.

• The invention provides a heat-dissipating fan and a housing thereof, wherein an sidewall of the housing extends outwards to enlarge the intake airflow area without modifying the assembling conditions between the existing fan and other heat dissipation elements.
• The shape of the housing at the air outlet side is kept unchanged in order to enhance the heat-dissipating efficiency of the fan.
• The fan may be mounted to a system or other heat dissipation elements without changing the assembling conditions with the system and the heat dissipation elements.

<summary>
* The electroluminescent display panel of the present invention is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate.
* The first electrode layer, first insulation layer, first luminescent layer, second insulation layer, and second electrode layer are all laminated in this order on the glass substrate.
* The first luminescent layer is made of a material which emits light including no visible red light components, and the second luminescent layer is made of a material which emits light including visible red light components.
* The second luminescent layer partly overlaps the first luminescent layer, forming a single layer portion and a double layer portion.
* The threshold voltage difference (VthD-VthS) is expressed as a function of the thickness of the second luminescent layer, and the value is positive when the thickness is greater than a certain value.
</summary>

• The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, which establishes a wireless connection to a connecting unit that sets up a connection to a network and/or the Internet.
• The terminal provides telephony via a network or the Internet, giving a considerable economic advantage, and the wireless connection is used to transfer data packets to the connecting unit in an expedient manner.

• The invention relates to a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, comprising growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate, and depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer.
• The use of a Ge buffer layer between high-dielectric oxides and Si or metal reduces the reactivity at the surface and enhances the epitaxy, and at least reduces the reaction layer between the deposited oxide and the substrate.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a receiver input circuit that aims to eliminate undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, while maintaining small signal behavior and using conventional components.
* The circuit comprises a control loop for amplification control, with the control signal being derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage, in addition to a second amplification control loop whose control signal is taken out prior to the mixer stage.
* The invention provides a solution to the problem of small signal behavior and distortion caused by non-linear components in the signal path, by providing multiple amplification control loops.
* The first control loop is used to avoid overloading of the mixer stage and/or varactor diodes in the tunable selective network, while the second control loop is used to avoid overloading of the mixer stage and/or oscillator due to powerful usable signals to which the receiver is tuned.
* The third amplification control loop is used to support the other control loops and to lower the signal response threshold, which enables better protection of the input circuit from negative influences of stronger spurious signals.
* The embodiment of the input circuit shown in FIG. 2 includes an input network with a PIN diode for controllable signal attenuation, a preamplifier stage with a bipolar transistor in grounded-base circuits, a mixer and oscillator stage, an intermediate frequency filter, rectifier circuits, and a control signal processing circuit.
* The control signal processing circuit smoothes the direct signals obtained in the rectifier circuits and directs them to a controlled shunt resistor, which controls the direct current flowing to the PIN diode and determines the operating current of the preamplifier stage.
* The invention has the advantage of providing a receiver input circuit that can eliminate undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, while maintaining small signal behavior and using conventional components.

<summary>
* The invention relates to network-implemented shared workspace environments and provides a method and apparatus for simple spontaneous setup.
* The system is designed for use in a telephone call, where the parties involved can initiate collaboration without complex setup processes.
* The invention includes a collaboration button and indicator on each telephone, which can be used to indicate availability for network collaboration.
* If both parties have a common collaboration application program, the indicator is illuminated, and the parties can initiate collaboration.
* The invention also includes a tear-down process in the event of a party hanging up on the call, and the collaborate indicator is extinguished if there are no remaining parties capable of collaboration.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to the insertion of clips or advertising sequences into a sequence of video pictures.
* The invention aims to optimize the visual impact of an advertising clip inserted into a video sequence by accounting for the regions of interest of the video sequence and the advertising clip in the selection process.
* According to the invention, the advertising clip is selected based on the degree of similarity between the salience map of the video sequence and the salience map of the advertising clip.
* The insertion point is advantageously a point of the video sequence corresponding to a shot change, and the regions of interest of the last pictures of the video sequence before the insertion point and the regions of interest of the advertising clips are determined.

• The invention relates to a recessed mask structure that reduces localized high electrical fields in very small dimension semiconductor devices, particularly in high speed and low density interconnect applications. • The invention positions the mask member at a location away from the high electric field points, typically within a range of 0.5 to 20 nanometers, with 5 nanometers being preferred, to reduce the likelihood of electrical breakdown and improve device performance. • The invention also provides a unique process that allows for both a recessed surface of the mask with respect to a device surface and a final mask thickness that is selectable and no thicker than necessary, while using quantities of mask material that are as thin as possible to reduce overall capacitance.

* The invention relates to a novel design implementation for an analog-to-digital converter that directly samples and downconverts a modulated IF carrier to baseband.

* The Downconverting Digitizer consists of a digitally controlled variable gain amplifier, a gain control logic element, an analog summing element, a sampling element, and a predictive digital filter.

* The digitally controlled variable gain amplifier adjusts the amplitude of the modulated IF input signal in accordance with the control signal generated by the gain control logic element.

* The gain control logic element converts the predictive filter output signal into a control signal that is used to set the gain value of the variable gain amplifier.

* The analog summing element generates the error signal by combining the amplifier output signal with the output of the digital summing element after being converted to analog representation by the digital-to-analog converter.

* The sampling element converts the analog error signal into a digital representation.

* The predictive digital filter utilizes an aliased oversampling technique to downconvert the modulated IF signal to a digital representation of the baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components.

<summary>
* The invention relates to active solid-state devices and methods for making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules.
* The problem of reproducibly fabricating semiconducting active layers with nano-dimensional features for direct electrical detection in sensing applications is solved using nanoimprint lithography.
* Nanoimprint lithography provides a method to fabricate arrays of semiconducting electrodes and covalently couple or synthesize anchoring probe molecules to the surfaces for multiplex detection of analytes.
* The invention also solves the problem of limited minimum feature sizes and high cost by patterning nano-scale features into a quartz plate using nanoimprint lithography, which can be applied directly to the surface of a wafer and transferring the pattern 1:1 into a photoresist layer.

• The present invention relates to a new, useful, and non-obvious method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, employing plating of the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe in order to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
• The invention provides a new, useful, and non-obvious method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, employing plating of the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe in order to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
• The present invention provides a new, useful, and non-obvious method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, employing plating of the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe in order to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.

* The invention relates to a mobile terminal that can selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN).
* The WWAN contains a plurality of base stations, while the WLAN contains at least one second base station for gathering service information of the first base stations.
* The mobile terminal has a first network module and a second network module, where the first network module is for connecting the WWAN and the second network module is for connecting the WLAN.
* The invention provides a method for a mobile terminal to select a serving base station of a wireless wide area network (WWAN) in a communication system.
* The method includes turning the first wireless module on according to a first rule, receiving the service information from the second base station, transmitting the service information to the first wireless module, and selecting one of the first base stations as a serving base station according to the service information to connect the WWAN.
* The invention can overcome the drawbacks of the conventional mobile terminals that need to switch between the WWAN and the WLAN, and can improve the connection speed and stability.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process for producing multilayered components, particularly capacitors.
* The process involves the use of a decal with electrodes and electrical components located in registered relation.
* The decal is manipulated to remove electrodes and locate them in stacked sub-assemblies, and the sub-assemblies are built-up to form assemblies of desired sizes.
* The invention also includes methods for interconnecting electrodes in stacked sub-assemblies and locating sub-assemblies in precise registered relation.
* The process eliminates the need for costly labor-intensive steps such as cutting, drilling, and firing.
* The invention also provides for the provision of apparatus or tooling to enable such fabrication.
* The resultant sub-assemblies and assemblies are themselves provided, and can be of many different sizes at very low cost and at high production rates.
* The invention is particularly useful for producing multilayered capacitors, coils, resistances, or combinations thereof.
* The electrodes are formed on a first decal and multiple first electrodes are provided in spaced apart and supported relation on the first carrier.
* The invention also includes the provision of a second decal with electrodes located in registered relation, and the decals are manipulated to remove the first electrodes and locate them in stacked sub-assemblies.
</summary>

• The present disclosure sets forth a hierarchical lattice structure that comprises unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength. (0025)
• FIG. 1 schematically depicts unit cells of a lattice structure that may be used in constructing materials having exceptional stiffness and strength for a given mass or volume of material. (0026)
• FIG. 1A, for example, schematically depicts a perspective view of unit cell 100 that is a first-order cell 101 comprised of three ligaments 102. (0027)
• A first-order cell has the longest ligament length of any cell used in a particular lattice structure, a second-order cell has the second longest ligament length, and so on. (0027)
• For the purposes of this specification, larger cells will be referred to as being of a higher order than smaller cells. (0027)
• Ligaments 102 may be of any desirable cross section, including but not limited to circular or rectangular. (0027)
• The ligaments may be hollow, semi-solid, or solid, or any combination thereof. (0028)
• In FIG. 1A, unit cell 100 is depicted by way of example and not limitation as having a tetrahedral geometric structure. (0028)
• Unit cells may also be comprised of multiple cell sizes. (0029)
• For example, as shown in FIG. 1B, unit cell 110 is comprised of a first-order cell 101 formed by ligaments 102, and three second-order cells. (0029)

• The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, including a wet gasification stage and a dry gasification stage.
• The wet gasification stage gasifies coal to produce a combustion gas at elevated pressure, while the dry gasification stage gasifies coal to produce a synthesis gas precursor at elevated pressure.
• The process includes enriching a first portion of the combustion gas with H2 and mixing at least a portion of the H2 -enriched gas with the synthesis gas precursor to provide a synthesis gas for hydrocarbon synthesis.
• The process also includes separating air to produce oxygen, which is used to combust the combustion gas to produce hot combusted gas and expand the hot combusted gas through a gas turbine expander to generate power and to produce hot exhaust gas.

<summary>
* The present invention provides a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, wherein an important improvement is imparted to the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface.
* The invention involves the use of a blocking film or passivation film to prevent the removal of oxygen from the surface or portion close to the surface of the superconducting material, and to provide a highly reliable surface utilizing device, especially a Josephson element.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination.
• The apparatus includes a base structure, a clamping arrangement, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism.
• The apparatus is used to sever a thin parallel-sided strip of foam sheet, which can then be examined microscopically for quality control purposes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to seismometers, especially those designed to operate on the ocean floor.
* The invention comprises a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical assumed by a seismometer in its operating position.
* The invention also comprises a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors carried in a seismometer.
* The detector(s) are suspended at the end of a shaft protruding from a ball rotating in an annular seat to form a free moving pendulum.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive method to determine the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical assumed by a recoverable device.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive apparatus for preserving the orientation assumed by a seismometer during its operation.
* The invention mounts a single geophone inside the door of a water-tight instrument housing.
* The invention provides a rigid connection between the detector and the frame of the seismometer to provide a good acoustic path between the sea bottom and the detector.
* The invention uses acoustic commands to trigger the clamping of the detector into position after deployment of the seismometer.
</summary>

• The present invention provides a humidity sensing element that is relatively fast and accurate, and does not require mechanical movements or special physical protection.
• The element consists of a first electrode, a porous coating of dielectric, minute particles of electron conductive material, and a second electrode pervious to moisture vapor.
• The impedance between the electrodes varies linearly with the relative humidity of the surrounding gaseous atmosphere in a suitable range of interest when excited by a suitable alternating current voltage.

<summary>
* The present invention provides a force transmission structure for a motor assembly, comprising a drive plate and a shaft.
* The drive plate has a mounting hole with at least three sections interconnected at a common area, and the shaft has a toothed portion with at least three teeth fittingly received in the sections of the mounting hole.
* The invention solves the problem of impact and noise generated by the conventional transmission structure by providing a smooth and stable transmission between the drive plate and the shaft.
* The invention also provides a motor assembly comprising the force transmission structure, a motor, and a gear train connecting the motor to the drive plate, wherein the drive plate is driven by the gear train through the force transmission structure.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to wireless communication systems and provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver.
• The invention provides a method of generating a mobile time reference, including providing a high frequency clock and a low frequency clock, generating a mobile time reference using the high frequency clock, maintaining the mobile time reference using the low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is not available, and continuing to generate the mobile time reference using the high frequency clock when the high frequency clock is again available.
• The invention also provides a block diagram of a third generation portable transceiver, including an antenna, a radio frequency subsystem, and a baseband subsystem. The radio frequency subsystem is coupled to the antenna and includes a high frequency oscillator and a low frequency oscillator.
• The baseband subsystem is coupled to the radio frequency subsystem and includes a free running counter coupled to the high frequency oscillator and the low frequency oscillator. The free running counter provides a mobile time reference to the system and has a wake mode and a sleep mode. During the wake mode, the free running counter uses the high frequency oscillator to generate the mobile time reference, and during the sleep mode, the free running counter uses the low frequency oscillator to maintain the mobile time reference.
• The invention can be viewed as providing a method of generating a mobile time reference, including providing a high frequency clock, providing a low frequency clock, generating a mobile time reference using the high frequency clock, maintaining the mobile time reference using the low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is not available, and continuing to generate the mobile time reference using the high frequency clock when the high frequency clock is again available.
• The invention can also be understood as providing a method of detecting, identifying, and monitoring of multipath signals in WCDMA systems, including providing a mobile time reference, monitoring the multipath signals using the mobile time reference, and identifying the multipath signals based on the monitored signals.
• The invention can be further understood as providing a system for generating a mobile time reference, including an antenna, a radio frequency subsystem, and a baseband subsystem. The radio frequency subsystem is coupled to the antenna and includes a high frequency oscillator and a low frequency oscillator. The baseband subsystem is coupled to the radio

<summary>
* One of the objects of our invention is to provide an individually fitted helmet liner that may be fitted to a wearer's head rapidly and in a simple manner.
* Another object of our invention is to provide an individually fitted helmet liner that may be refitted to accommodate a changed head size.
* Still another object of our invention is to provide an individually fitted helmet liner that has uniform and hence predictable structural characteristics.
* Further object of our invention is to provide an individually fitted helmet liner that does not require trimming after fitting.
* We contemplate a helmet liner in which a plurality of layers, each of which consists of an elastic thermoplastic sheet formed with an array of pockets, are arranged in superposed contacting relationship with one another.
* By leaving the liner pockets open and unfilled rather than filling them with relatively imcompressible spacer elements, we are able to provide a helmet liner which is compliant enough to smooth out the effects of relative layer alignment.
* Our liner, by contrast, need merely be maintained in compression during the fitting procedure to deform the layers to the proper extent.
* We have found that by having the liner pockets open and unfilled, we are able to eliminate the drawstrings used in the previous liner to maintain the liner in tension during size adjustment.
* Our liner resists the tendency to shift position on the wearer's head and does not require the use of drawstrings or the like during fitting or require trimming afterward.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a multiorifice structure and a method of fabrication for atomizing fluids.
• The multiorifice structure has a plurality of angularly disposed passageways formed by alternating layers of solid rods and cylindrical members.
• The passageways are formed by fusing the layers together, and the thickness of the structure is determined by the effective aperture of the interstices.
• The structure is designed to provide a directional component parallel to the axis of the interstices, which improves the atomization of the fluid.
• The method of fabrication involves fusing concentric layers of alternating rods and cylindrical members into an integral assembly, and then slicing it to produce the multiorifice structure.
• The structure can be made from materials such as metals or plastics, and the coating material can be deposited on the surface of the rods and cylindrical members to facilitate fusion.

* The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device, particularly an insulated gate field effect (IGFET) type, having a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure.
* The invention provides a method of fabricating a semiconductor device by which the controllability of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall is improved.
* According to the invention, the oxide portion on the sidewall of the gate is formed by forming an insulating film on the gate electrode, and then forming a layer on the insulating film and anisotropically etching away the layer using RIE, except a portion thereof on the gate sidewall.
* The invention also provides a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device in which an LDD structure can be formed by a low temperature process, and the possibility of etching away the source/drain region is avoided.

* The present invention relates to Internet telephony and improving the end-user interface for Internet Protocol (IP) telephone communication.
* The invention provides an enhanced radio telephone that can be connected to a personal computer (PC) and used as a significantly improved IP telephone.
* The enhanced radio telephone includes an internal speech coder that is implemented for low power consumption and can be used with a relatively low-performance PC for effective IP telephony, reducing echo problems and improving speech quality.

<summary>
* The invention relates to devices for producing electrical power from surface waves.
* The invention improves upon prior art devices by using a single gas-tight container submerged to a depth slightly below anticipated wave and swell troughs.
* The container has a fixed depth rigid end or surface held at a relatively fixed depth relative to the water body mean water level or wave troughs.
* The invention uses a flexible, gas-tight, reinforced elastomer or flexible metal bellows or diaphragm to connect the fixed and movable ends of the container.
* The invention enhances energy capture by partial evacuation of the container or venting of the container to a floating surface atmospheric vent or to a floating surface expandable bellows or reservoir.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to the field of scraped surface heat exchangers.
• The problem to be solved is the difficulty in mounting blades onto a drive shaft while using a pin type connection.
• The present invention provides an apparatus that facilitates the mounting of a scraped surface heat exchanger blade onto a drive shaft while still using a pin type connection.
• The blade includes a blade body with a first side and a second side, and a scraper edge and a hinge edge.
• The blade has at least one mounting hole extending through the blade body generally proximate to the hinge edge.
• The blade also includes a first L-shaped locking track protruding into the first side of the blade, having a first entry track extending from the hinge edge and an intermediate track extending from the entry track to the mounting hole.
• The blade also includes a second L-shaped locking track protruding into the second side of the blade, having a second entry track extending from the hinge edge and an intermediate track extending from the second entry track to and past the mounting hole.
• The invention provides a method for mounting a blade to a scraped surface heat exchanger drive shaft by pivotal connection with a mounting pin.
• The method includes providing a blade body with at least one mounting hole extending through the blade body generally proximate to the hinge edge.
• The blade is locked against longitudinal movement in one direction while permitting pivoting movement relative to the drive shaft using tracks on both sides of the blade interfering with the pin.
• The invention provides a scraped surface heat exchanger including a drive shaft with at least one mounting pin, and a blade mounted to the drive shaft by pivotal connection with the mounting pin.
• The blade includes a blade body with a first side and a second side, and a scraper edge and a hinge edge.
• The invention solves the problem of difficulty in mounting blades onto a drive shaft while using a pin type connection.
• The invention provides a simple and efficient method for mounting blades onto a drive shaft using a pin type connection.
• The in

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process and an apparatus for detecting and eliminating defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in a cigarette magazine.
* The detection process involves using at least one optical checking element, such as a camera, to detect an image of a plurality of cigarettes located in the cigarette magazine.
* The image is evaluated by an image-processing device, and if there is a deviation from a reference image and/or from at least one reference value, an error signal is produced.
* The invention also relates to an elimination process for eliminating defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in the cigarette magazine.
* The elimination process involves detecting a defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarette using the detection process, and then ejecting a plurality of cigarettes located in an ejecting zone assigned to an ejecting unit.
* The number of cigarettes ejected is large enough for a transversely located cigarette to be ejected in full.
* The invention also provides an ejecting unit with a housing fixed relative to the cigarette magazine or connected thereto.
* The ejecting unit has a linear cylinder for guiding a linearly displaceable carriage, and the carriage is connected to the actual ejector of the ejecting unit.
* The ejecting unit is actuated in reaction to the detection of a defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarette, and the ejector is displaced in the direction of the rear wall of the ejector and/or in the direction of the chute.
* The front wall of the ejector is connected to a housing-like device, and the four front walls and/or housing-like devices of the four ejectors are spaced apart from one another.
* The distance between the front walls corresponds approximately to double the width of one cigarette, but it may also be selected to be larger.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a device for interconnecting a high voltage cable with an apparatus and/or with a second high voltage cable.
* The invention provides a simplified connection system for all accessories and interconnections, offering advantages such as factory pretesting, reduction of installation time and cost, and simplified field testing.
* The rigid insulator design and dimensions are the same for all applications, with the only variation being the diameter of the cable or apparatus entrance.
* The interface components do not include any gas or oil, resulting in a safer and more reliable connection system.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fixing mechanism for a tool in a machine tool, particularly in a field of technology where the tool is subject to various forces and movements during operation.
* The fixing mechanism comprises a tool, its frame, and a tool holder in the frame of the machine tool, wherein at least one of the connecting surfaces in the tool frame and in the tool holder is shaped as a curved surface.
* The first contact surface in connection with the tool frame and the second contact surface in the tool holder are adjusted to be placed against each other in the operational position of the fixing mechanism, transmitting machining forces between the tool frame and the tool holder.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to switching circuitry used to drive display drivers, and particularly to providing switching circuitry that operates at high speeds while producing low EMI output.
* The invention provides methods and apparatus for generating supply voltages for display driver circuits at high efficiencies and with low quantities of radiated energy, and in particular, to utilize switching regulator circuits that have been modified to cancel out radiated noise by creating multiple paths for current flow.
</summary>

<summary>
* Cell imbalance conditions are detected in a battery and rebalancing/charging is performed to correct cell voltage imbalances.
* Certain embodiments disclosed herein may provide systems and techniques to reduce the time spent rebalancing and charging vehicle batteries.
* The algorithm for determining times associated with rebalancing/charging the battery includes measuring the cell voltage and determining the rate at which charge is acquired by the cells, and the battery is charged based on the measured voltage and the rate of charge acquisition.
</summary>

• The invention provides an AC-to-DC converter as lamp power supply that converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage at predetermined value set by potentiometer.
• The output lamp has neither low frequency flicker nor high frequency flicker, reducing eyes' fatigue to minimum level and protecting eyesight and health to maximum level.
• The invention provides a detailed description of the implementation of the AC-to-DC converter, including the use of a Flyback topology, a sampling circuit, a feedback and dimming circuit, and an output filter, as well as the connection of the various components and circuits.

• The present invention relates to a system for controlling the light levels in a space, such as an interior room, by controlling both the artificial light in the space and the control of motorized window treatments in the space to achieve a reasonably constant illumination on task surfaces throughout the space.
• The invention is directed to a system to reduce or prevent sun glare, which can potentially occur at low sun angles due to sunshine through windows or other openings, e.g., skylights, surrounding the space.
• The system comprises a sensor for sensing an illumination level in at least a portion of the space, a plurality of dimmable electric lamps providing the electric light to supplement the daylight illumination of the space, and a control system controlling the dimming levels of the plurality of electric lamps.
• According to yet another aspect, the invention comprises an illumination maintenance system for maintaining a desired illumination profile in a space throughout at least a portion of a day where the illumination sources include daylight and artificial light, the system comprising a sensor for sensing an illumination level in at least a portion of the space, a plurality of electric lamps providing artificial light to supplement the daylight illumination of the space, and a control system controlling the dimming levels of the plurality of electric lamps.

<summary>
1. Before September 2001, security vulnerabilities in aviation were identified, including weaknesses in screening passengers and baggage, controlling access to secure areas, and protecting air traffic control computer systems and facilities.
* The Transportation Security Administration (TSA) was created in 2001 and given the responsibility of ensuring security in all modes of transportation, including aviation.
2. TSA faced difficulties in meeting deadlines and achieving goals, such as deploying explosives detection systems and hiring and training personnel.
* TSA experienced operational and management control problems, including delays in deploying some explosives detection systems and hiring and training personnel.
3. To strengthen control over access to secure areas of airports and other transportation facilities, TSA is pursuing initiatives that make greater use of technology and information.
* TSA is developing a Transportation Workers Identification Card (TWIC) program to establish a uniform, nationwide standard for the secure identification of 12 million workers who require unescorted physical or cyber access to secure areas at airports and other transportation facilities.
4. TSA has begun to develop initiatives that could enable it to use its passenger screening resources more efficiently, such as a registered traveler program.
* The registered traveler program would prescreen low-risk travelers and provide them with a unique identifier or card that would enable them to be screened more quickly.
5. FAA has continued to strengthen the security of the nation's air traffic control computer systems and facilities in response to recommendations made by GAO.
* FAA has established an information systems security management structure and implemented an incident response center, but it faces challenges in increasing its intrusion detection capabilities and managing information systems security throughout the agency.
6. Vulnerabilities remain in securing air cargo, general aviation, and airport perimeter security, according to aviation experts, TSA officials, and others.
* Less than 5 percent of cargo placed on passenger airplanes is physically screened, and TSA lacks a comprehensive plan with long-term goals and performance targets for cargo security.
7. TSA has awarded a contract to test and evaluate various technologies at three pilot sites to improve passenger screening.
* The next-generation Computer

* The Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 (LDA) and the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) sections 4911 and 162(e) have different definitions of lobbying-related terms.
* LDA covers only contacts with federal government officials, while IRC definitions cover contacts with officials in other levels of government and attempts to influence the public through grassroots lobbying.
* The LDA lobbying definition does not cover lobbying of state or local government officials, while both IRC definitions cover contacts with state government officials to influence state legislation.
* IRC section 162(e) provides an exception for contacts with local legislative officials regarding legislation of direct interest to the organization, but the LDA definition does not have a similar exception.
* Both IRC definitions cover grassroots lobbying, such as television commercials, newspaper advertisements, and direct mail campaigns to influence federal, state, and local legislation.
* To determine if a lobbyist's contact with a federal government official is covered by one of the three definitions, one must review the statutory provisions, regulations, and guidance.
* The differences in coverage under the different definitions can affect who must register and what they must report under LDA, and options for harmonizing the definitions are being considered.

• The Government Accountability Office (GAO) has been assessing strategic sourcing in the federal government for over a decade, with a focus on procurement for services.
• Strategic sourcing involves analyzing spending patterns to identify opportunities for cost savings and improving procurement processes.
• The federal government spends over half of its procurement budget on services, but has difficulty managing services acquisition and purchasing services inefficiently.
• Leading companies in the private sector have been successful in strategic sourcing services by analyzing spending patterns, centralizing management, and tailoring tactics to the complexity and number of suppliers for each service.

* The current surface transportation programs are ineffective in addressing key transportation challenges such as increasing congestion and growing freight demand due to unclear federal goals and lack of links to needs or performance.
* The federal role in surface transportation should be reexamined to ensure sustainability in the new fiscal reality, with targeted investment from all levels of government and the private sector.
* Surface transportation programs lack effective tools and approaches to improve results and emphasize return on investment, such as using economic analysis in project selection and requiring post-project evaluations.
* The federal government should establish well-defined goals based on identified areas of national interest and establish a clear federal role in achieving each goal, with a greater role in areas of national interest and a lower role in areas where state and local governments can carry out the federal interest.
* Proposals to restructure and fund surface transportation programs should consider how costs and revenues will be shared among federal, state, local, and private stakeholders, and address the need to better align fees and taxes with use and benefits.

• The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) engages in three primary activities: aviation safety oversight, air traffic control, and airport infrastructure development. • The costs associated with each of these activities depend on the nature and usage of the specific service provided, and by whether the flight operates at peak periods, and the ticket taxes and fees collected from system users do not necessarily reflect the costs imposed on the system by their use.

<summary>
1. In 1993, the Institute of Medicine published a report on secret US chemical weapon programs during WWII, identifying 60,000 military personnel and 6,400 civilians who were potentially exposed to mustard agents and lewisite.
2. In 1993, VA was found to lack information about individuals exposed during secret DOD chemical tests.
3. OUSD (P&R) developed a database with information on 6,400 servicemembers and civilians exposed to chemical substances during testing, training, transportation, production, and storage.
4. A contractor was tasked with analyzing, extracting, and developing a database of information on all volunteers and/or other subjects potentially exposed to live chemical or biological substances.
5. The contractor identified locations of human exposures to chemical substances, including those resulting from tests and various activities such as transportation, production, storage, and disposal.
6. In 2004, DOD stopped actively searching for additional individuals potentially exposed during Project 112 tests, citing a lack of resources and a decision by OASD (HA) officials.
7. Since then, additional individuals have been identified through various non-DOD sources, including the Institute of Medicine's study and DOD's own research.
8. The current effort to identify individuals potentially exposed to chemical or biological substances lacks clear and consistent objectives, scope of work, and information needs, which affects DOD's ability to know whether it has accomplished the project's goals.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The struggle between Mexican DTOs and the government of Mexico has been ongoing since the 1980s, with a national priority set in 2006.
2. Firearms are a crucial aspect of DTO operations, and the Strategy notes that criminal organizations acquire firearms from the United States through various means.
3. According to ATF data, 70% of the 104,850 firearms seized by Mexican authorities and traced from 2009 to 2014 originated in the United States.
4. The number of firearms seized and traced fluctuated significantly from 2009 to 2011, followed by a steady decline after 2011.
5. DTOs prefer high-caliber weapons, including assault rifles and military-grade equipment, which are often trafficked from the United States.
6. ICE has seized 5,951 firearms destined for Mexico in the last six years, with 39% being long guns.
7. ATF has taken steps to combat firearms trafficking, including implementation of Demand Letter 3, which requires dealers to report multiple sales of certain rifles.
</summary>

<summary>
* Each state has a central repository for criminal history information contributed by law enforcement agencies, prosecutors, courts, and corrections agencies.
* Efforts to improve criminal history records nationwide predate NCHIP by over 2 decades, with the development of computerized criminal history systems in the states and the establishment of the Law Enforcement Assistance Administration.
* NCHIP was designed by the Bureau of Justice Assistance to implement federal mandates to enhance public safety by enhancing the nation's criminal history records systems.
* States have made progress in automating criminal history records and making them accessible nationally, with the percentage of automated records increasing from 79% in 1993 to 89% in 2001.
* BJS awards NCHIP grants to states to support NICS in conducting background checks of firearms' purchasers, with a total of $165.2 million awarded from 2000 to 2003.
* States have used NCHIP grants to improve criminal history records, including automating older records, and to enhance the National Sex Offender Registry and the NCIC Protection Order File.
</summary>

• The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA) of 1980 created the Superfund program to clean up the nation’s most severely contaminated hazardous waste sites. • EPA sets standards for emissions and operations, requires engineering controls, and establishes operating parameters for incinerators used at Superfund sites, which are based on studies of the site’s characteristics conducted during the incinerator’s design and construction.

• The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)'s financial statements for the fiscal years ended September 30, 2007, and 2006, were fairly presented in all material respects.
• However, misstatements may nevertheless occur in other financial information reported by SEC, and could not be prevented or detected due to internal control deficiencies.
• SEC's financial reporting process, including its accounts receivable for disgorgements and penalties, transaction fee revenue, and preparing financial statement disclosures, contains material weaknesses.
• SEC's internal control over financial reporting was ineffective in preventing or detecting material misstatements in its financial statements as of September 30, 2007, due to significant deficiencies in its financial reporting process.
• SEC's financial management system does not conform to the requirements of OMB Circular No. A-127, Financial Management Systems, which requires that financial systems have common data elements, consistent internal controls, and efficient transaction entry.
• SEC's period-end financial reporting process for recording transactions, maintaining account balances, and preparing financial statements and disclosures are supported to varying degrees by a collection of automated systems that are not integrated or compatible with its general ledger system.
• SEC's documentation used to crosswalk individual accounts to the financial statement line items contained an incorrect routing to a line item on SEC's Statement of Budgetary Resources for SEC's year-end financial statement preparation process, which caused a material error in SEC's draft financial statements.

<summary>
* The Postal Service is the largest civilian employer in the US, with over 765,000 employees at the end of fiscal year 1997.
* The Service has a commitment to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and strives to create a diverse workforce.
* The Service's diversity development program aims to promote diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
* The program includes initiatives such as recruitment and retention efforts, management training, and mentoring programs.
* The program also focuses on creating a diverse and inclusive workplace culture.
* The Service has made progress in increasing diversity in the workplace, with women and minorities making up a larger proportion of the workforce.
* However, there are still areas for improvement, such as the representation of women and minorities in higher-level positions.
</summary>

• The DOD defines an MWD as any canine bred, procured, or acquired to meet DOD’s requirements to support operations in the protection of installations, resources, and personnel. The Air Force, Army, and Navy have different roles in tracking information related to MWDs, including their removal from service.
• The number of MWDs adopted or transferred during 2011 through 2015 varied, with the highest numbers in 2012 and 2013. Available data for 55 percent of the MWDs adopted in 2014 and 2015 indicate that prevalent medical conditions included skin, dental, and musculoskeletal issues.

* The Comanche program is a low-altitude reconnaissance and attack helicopter program that was established in 1983.
* The program has experienced significant delays and cost overruns, with the estimated cost of the program now over $44 billion.
* The program has faced challenges in software development, including problems with software integration and configuration management.
* The program has also experienced delays in verification testing of the flight control system software, which is critical to the helicopter's first flight.
* The program office has proposed a restructuring of the program to address these issues, including deferring additional developmental efforts until fiscal year 2002 and beyond.

• The Food Stamp Program provides eligibility and benefit requirements for households receiving TANF.
• States can give categorical eligibility to households receiving TANF-funded services or benefits, making them eligible for food stamps.
• States can exempt some or all vehicles from counting as assets in determining food stamp eligibility.
• States can use reporting options or waivers to change the way households with earnings are required to report changes in their circumstances.
• States are held responsible for payment errors resulting from miscalculating benefits at certification, but not for errors resulting from household-reported changes in income or circumstances.

<summary>
1. HUD is responsible for administering various housing and community development programs, including Section 8 housing assistance, CDBG, and HOME.
2. HUD's fiscal year 2000 budget proposal includes 19 new initiatives and programs, totaling $210 million in funding.
3. The proposed budget does not include a detailed explanation for the $4.2 billion advance appropriation for fiscal year 2001.
4. HUD's CDBG Program provides grants to communities for activities that benefit low- and moderate-income people, prevent or eliminate slum or blight, or meet urgent community needs.
5. The fiscal year 2000 budget request includes $209 million for Contract Administration, a new initiative to manage project-based Section 8 housing assistance contracts.
6. HUD's Section 8 Financial Management Center would oversee the work of contract administrators, and the Department would select contract administrators through a competitive procurement process.
7. The Inspector General and the National Academy of Public Administration have cited weaknesses in HUD's contracting and procurement practices.
8. HUD is proposing an increase in its EZ Program, including $45 million for Urban Empowerment Zones and $10 million for meritorious communities that applied for Round II EZ designation but were not chosen.
9. The budget proposal raises questions about HUD's capacity to manage the increase in program funding and implement new initiatives, given the Department's ongoing organizational reform and the need for dedicated resources to plan, implement, and manage programs over the long term.
</summary>

• The Military Health System operated by DOD is large and complex, with a dual health care mission of readiness and benefits.
• The replacement medical center will serve as the only tertiary-level referral hospital for the EUCOM, Central Command, and Africa Command theaters of operation.
• The beneficiary population at Baumholder is expected to reduce when the brigade combat team located there leaves, with little impact on the workload and sizing requirements for the replacement medical center.
